results.title: Folk dances
results.brief_description: An attractively set series of folk-dances, performed by dancers in authentic costumes, dancing to local folk-tunes. The dances include: the Moldavanetz, a Moldavian dance; the Krezhachek, a dance of Belo-Russia; and the Kazaki, a dance of Azerbijzhan. Music only.

results.title: Folk art: the Diana Brandt way
results.brief_description: Nationally renowned folk artist Diana Brandt brings her expertise, handy hints and experience to help you create traditional Bavarian Folk Art for your home. The equipment needed to complete two projects is shown and explained. The three strokes that comprise folk art are demonstrated clearly, simply and step-by-step so that you may practice to perfection at your own pace in your home. Includes scores of hints and shortcuts. Project One is a beautiful oval storage box with a delightfully rustic antique flower arrangement painted on the cover. Project Two is a teapot stand with a simple baroque design.

results.title: Folk art
results.brief_description: Shows a variety of home crafts. A wood carver creating complex scenes and individual figures; women painting the walls of their homes with brightly colored floral designs; a potter making and decorating attractive pieces of pottery; expert needle women designing and working intricate pieces of embroidery.

constellations_primary.name: Sounds unreal
constellations_primary.description: A history of syncing sound effects, a craft known as Foley in the USA and bootstepping in the UK.

results.title: Foghorn Leghorn: classic Looney Tunes cartoons
results.brief_description: This video collection presents nine of the best of that wisecracking rooster, Foghorn Leghorn. For decades now his practical jokes and witty remarks have captivated audiences of all ages and it is his unique way of talking that makes Foghorn Leghorn stand out from the rest of the crowd. But where would Foghorn Leghorn be without his “companions” Henery Hawk and Barnyard Dog, both of who feature in this collection of cartoons. Suitable entertainment for all the family.

results.title: Foetal surgery
results.brief_description: A 4 1/2 month pregnant monkey (the equivalent to 7 months in human terms), has its foetus operated on to create a condition that occurs in human babies - the short bowel syndrome, for later study under laboratory conditions. When the baby monkey was born there was virtually no scar tissue, and the foetus had replaced enough of the removed bowel to survive.

results.title: Focus on wonderland
results.creator_credit: Hawley Lawrence, Russ McCaig, Steve Bridge and FilmFair
results.brief_description: A couple spend a day in Los Angeles visiting movie lots, shops, markets and the beach. Later they visit the famed night spots of the city. Without commentary, this film uses natural sound and popular music.

results.title: Focus on uppers
results.creator_credit: Noel Nosseck, American Educational Films, Directions Unlimited and Avanti Films
results.brief_description: This film illustrates the dangerous effects of amphetamines on the body. Explains that unlike other pills they do not put the body’s functions in order but rather cause users to overextend themselves to the point of physical and emotional exhaustion. Narrated by Greg Morris.

results.title: Focus on the Nile
results.brief_description: An account of the part played by the River Nile in the life of Egypt and the Sudan. From the confluence of the Blue and White Niles the film follows the banks of the great river and illustrates the importance of irrigation to the Sudan. The film ends by outlining the reason for Egypt’s apprehension regarding foreign control of the headwaters of the river.

results.title: Focus on shipping
results.brief_description: A survey of Britain’s merchant shipping industry. Scenes are given of merchant ships in some of the far-away ports of the world, of the vital export cargoes they carry and of aspects of the work of the shipbuilding yards.
